alert.note: Alert for Edmonson (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 06 at 7:35PM EST until March 15 at 5:48PM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 AM CST/145 AM EST/ MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...Portions central Kentucky, including the following counties, Hardin, Larue, Ohio, Grayson, Hart, Butler and Edmonson. * WHEN...Until 1245 AM CST Monday /145 AM EST Monday/. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 635 PM CST /735 PM EST/, trained weather spotters reported flooding in the warned area. Flooding is already occurring. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Elizabethtown, Leitchfield, Hodgenville, Morgantown, Casey, Lee, Clarkson, New Haven, Upton and Caneyville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
